snippet: Should patients be held responsible for not showing up for follow-up tests and procedures? Does the medical profession have an ethical and legal duty to try to track down the individuals?
abstract: Should patients be held responsible for not showing up for follow-up tests and procedures? Does the medical profession have an ethical and legal duty to try to track down the individuals?
lead_paragraph: Several years ago, I saw a woman with unexpectedly high blood pressure. Her readings were as high as 140/110, way above the normal value of 120/80. Though she was otherwise healthy, she was at risk of a stroke.
